title: Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development 
(Licensing of Outdoor Events – Planning and Development Act 2000) 
Regulations 2025. 

(2) These regulations and the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 
to 2024 shall be construed as one and may be collectively cited as the Planning 
and Development Regulations 2001 to 2025. 

Amendment of Article 186 of the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development (licensing outdoor event - planning development act 2000) regulation 2025 (2) regulation planning development regulation 2001 2024 shall construed one may collectively cited planning development regulation 2001 2025 amendment article 186 principal regulation

title: Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning
heading: 3. Article 186 of the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
3. Article 186 of the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 (S.I. No. 
600 of 2001) is amended by the substitution of sub-article (1A) with the 
following: 

“(1A) A local authority shall not accept an application for a licence for a 
proposed event unless a pre-application consultation meeting under article 184 
has taken place in relation to the event during the 36 month period prior to the 
date of the event to which the application relates or, in the case of an application 
for a number of events, 36 months prior to the holding of the first event.” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 February, 2025. 

JAMES BROWNE, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 25th February, 2025.
